name: Ramada Limited San Bruno/San Francisco Airport West

reviews.text: The room was terrible, holes in the carpet, dirty bathroom vanity, ( the girl at the desk actually came up in the room to see tghe vanity and USED our towels to try and clean) Comforter had stains on the botom of it, dirty furniture. Elevator doors were scratching closing and openiing.. Stayed less thean 2 hrs and checked out. Ramada General Offices very NOT interested in my complaints. Never return my phone calls. I would not stay at any other Ramada.
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.text: I stayed at this Hotel on March 2009 and I realized that, the comments I read were not true, this is a very good Hotel at affordable prices.
reviews.title: Very Clean Hotel and Good Management

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The General Manager and his Staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: What happened to this hotel??

likes.disliked: — The noisy, dirty room and parking our car outside in the weather

reviews.title: You Have to Be Desperate
reviews.text: We have used this property for several years as a "park -n-fly for our travels from SFO. The room was not clean and they put us on the front side with all the noise from El Camino. We were there to get a good night's sleep before we had to fly.

They used to put our car in the garage under the hotel so it wouldn't be in the hot sun while we were away. Not anymore, the car is parked outside and will be a mess when we return home in 3 weeks. We left our car there last time for 6 weeks and it was parked underneath out of the weather.
reviews.title: Dirtiest Room

reviews.text: This hotal has all the amenities needed for a stay like Gym, Internet, Parking, laundry, Bfast etc. Room also has all the necessary appliances needed by a person like M/W, Refrigerator, dryer, coffee maker. Staff is very friendly and they ensure the best services to you. Ideally located and good value for your money.
reviews.title: Hospitable Staff, Ideally located, Quick Services, Value for Money...
Quiet and Nice
reviews.text: A nice quiet and good value for the money. Especially the monthly rate is good.

For a solo business traveler like myself, who has a few weeks or few months job assignment in the San Francisco Bay Area, I strongly recommend Ramada Limited, San Bruno. We have three (3) means of public transportation, Caltrain (train), Samtrans (Bus), and BART (Train-subway) to downtown San Francisco. Caltrain station is a 5 minutes walk from the hotel, the bus stops right at the hotel, and the BART station is only a 1.5 mile drive (5 minutes), with $1 a day parking at the station. When you get back to the hotel, you have the choice of all kinds of meals. one block east of the hotel is the "Restaurant Row" of San Mateo. There are, at least ,20 different restaurants ranging from Italian, Middleastern, Mexican, Chinese, Korean, Japanese, Thai, Indian, Brazillian, etc. are within the walking distance. The Spa (a Jacuzzi and a sauna) this hotel provides can also help you relax after the long exhausting work day. The hotel also has an exercise room. The very reliable FREE WiFi Internet connection is also a PLUS! This relatively economical hotel provides the convenience of commute to downtown San Francisco, all the amenities that a single business traveler might desire, and the very reasonable price for the area. The hotel is very close to the San Francisco International Airport, also. THEREFORE, I strongly recommend Ramada Limited, San Bruno to solo business travelers to San Francisco.
reviews.title: Convinient to Commute to Downtown SF via BART with SPA an all amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: M. Andrew Urano, Esq. Attorney-at-Law
reviews.title: Indifferent management - avoid this one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was questionable...reasonably close to SF airport. Somewhat rundown. The after hours check-in window is a dead give away. Not what you would expect from a Ramada! Staff is unfriendly and manager not willing to resolve problems. Avoid this one and pay a little extra quality SF airport hotel.
reviews.title: You could do better

reviews.text: I spent three nights here in October. It's a great location if you need to be near the airport and there are plenty of places to eat and shop in the area. Good freeway access. There is free parking.
reviews.title: Bring Your Own Maid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many problems. Rooms and the facility in general were dirty. Bed was hard. The Internet access worked for a total of 30 minutes while I was there and the staff didn't seem to care.
reviews.title: Close to the airport but needs some help...

likes.disliked: — no hot water, staff was unhelpful & unprofessional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is one enclosed courtyard and one open courtyard and the combination means that on the way to your room, you'll get to enjoy a pack of smokes free of charge. There's no way to avoid it so non-smokers beware.
reviews.title: Clean Room but overall Shabby and umkempt

likes.liked: — the room was well taken care of
likes.disliked: — Common areas shabby internet access problems, continental breakfast

reviews.title: Ultimate Spa Vacation
reviews.text: I wouldn't walk on the carpet in my bare feet for fear that I'd catch something.

My wife and I stayed here 1 night after a long trip back from a 3-week vacation in Europe. We live in the Central Valley but since our flight arrived late, we opted to crash at a hotel before taking the train back home. We got a great rate on a 1-bedroom suite with a jacuzzi about 3 or 4 weeks prior to arrival. Now I know why the rate is so cheap -- it's a no-frills Ramada Limited close to the airport, yet this place is poorly-managed and seems to be in need of serious upgrades and/or renovation.
reviews.title: An appreciated rescue

reviews.text: They loved the many channels on the TV and the hot tub.
reviews.title: Kids loved it - me less so

reviews.text: I could have had a less hard matress and maybe a shower with hot water. Tepid was the best the room had. Would have liked more than cold cereal/stale bread for breakfast
reviews.title: No problems with this hotel

reviews.text: It was convenient, it was cheap. I got what I paid for. Never mind.
reviews.title: Very disappointing - not clean

reviews.text: I booked this hotel because I was offered a good rate. I also needed a hotel near the airport. So I was very curious about this hotel after reading the negative comments. Yes the Ramada Limited is a simple no frills hotel. But it wasn't bad at all. The hotelstaff was friendly. My room was spacious and clean. You've got a refrigerator, microwave, coffeemaker and free WIFI. The tv has many channels. Sleeping was not a problem altough you can hear planes from time by time. I agree the breakfastroom is small and looks shabby and not very clean. But you won't need to have breakfast there. Just take some food to your room, use the in-room coffeemaker and have breakfast in your room. The location is also good, it's in downtown San Bruno with many shops and eateries around. There is a Samtrans busstop nearby with buses to San Francisco. Caltrain is not far away and has trains to San Francisco and San Jose. The BART-station is a bit far away, it's in a shoppingmall. However, the hotel has no free shuttle to/from the airport. Use a taxi or consider the Super8 shuttle, the super8 is at 421 Camino Real and not far away from the Ramada Limited.
reviews.title: Ramada Roach Hotel San Bruno

reviews.text: I had an unpleasant one-night stay in this hotel in early November. It was chosen for it's proximity to San Francisco airport and I arrived after a long journey from the UK.
reviews.title: Very Good

aka: Ramada Limited San Francisco Airport West/San Bruno Hotel
